intro: Banksia preissii, commonly known as the golden banksia, is a species of flowering plant in the Proteaceae family. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flower spikes that emerge from a woody cone. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology includes long, narrow leaves and a tall, cylindrical stem. Banksia preissii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
